metrics.letter_text:
Dear Leyi,

I'm writing this at 3:47 AM. Not for poetry. Because my body won't let me sleep until I tell you something true.

*

Here it is: I have been dead. Thirteen seconds, cardiac arrest, sophomore year. You want to know what death is? Nothing. Not peace, not light. Just the universe hitting delete. But when they brought me back—before I remembered my name, before I understood I had a body—there was this weight. This debt. Three years later I met you. The debt was you. My atoms had made a p
